intro: Chaubardiella subquadrata, commonly known as the quadrangular rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant features small, four-angled stems and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. It is native to regions of southern Europe and the Mediterranean, where it is often found in dry, sunny environments.
